availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Established as a moderate Whig newspaper by Walter Newman Haldeman. Expressed strong Confederate sympathies with the start of the Civil War. Printed the records of the Provisional Government of Kentucky in 1861. Headquarters moved to Nashville in September 1861 after U.S. troops seized the newspaper office in Louisville. Newspaper ceased printing with U.S. occupation of Nashville in February 1862. Resumed publication after the war. Combined with the Louisville Journal and became the Louisville Courier-Journal in 1868.

ab.bibl:
Dennis Cusick, "Haldeman, Walter Newman" in The Kentucky Encyclopedia, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 398.
KYR-0004-033-0022.
